DOC.brief_summary: 80 % endometrial cancer patient overweight obese . Preclinical clinical data show caloric restriction ( CR ) protect organ injury decrease perioperative morbidity . This feasibility trial evaluate effect 6 week perioperative CR surgical patient-reported outcome 20 obese newly diagnose endometrial cancer patient . The intervention provide individualize CR program , meal replacement product nutritional counselling session .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Effect Perioperative Caloric Restriction Program Perioperative Outcomes Patients With Obesity Endometrial Cancer
DOC.criteria: Newly diagnose Endometrial Cancer BMI30 kg/m2 18 year age old Scheduled definitive surgical intervention ( hysterectomy , bilateral salpingoopherectomy without lymphadenectomy ) follow 23 week part standard care Have ECOG performance status 01 Have life expectancy least 1 year Inability communicate English BMI30 kg/m2 Age18 Have uncontrolled serious medical psychiatric condition would affect ability participate intervention study , ( e.g. , severe/uncontrolled diabetes mellitus , severe cardiac and/or pulmonary disease and/or depression ) Diagnosed invasive malignancy currently , last five year expect undergo active treatment either cytotoxic chemotherapy radiation 6 week caloric restriction period
